intro: Murdannia crocea subsp. crocea, commonly known as the red-flowered murdannia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
